channel.title: All the tech news (Posts about event)

item.title: Meet Our Newest Innovators: Welcoming AI4SE Interns as JetBrains Employees!
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🚀 Exciting times at JetBrains as we welcome our new AI4SE interns! These recent graduates from TU Delft have transitioned from academic projects to full-time roles, applying their MSc thesis work in real-world settings. Meet Milan, Nadine, Saga, and Sergey, who gained hands-on experience during their internships and contributed to significant research. Their work will soon lead to journal publications! 📚 The AI4SE program, launched in 2023, combines academic research with industry…

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Katie Fraser
Category: event

item.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: Amazon EC2, Amazon Q Developer, IPv6 updates, and more (September 1, 2025)
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
📅 This week, the AWS Heroes Summit in Seattle highlighted the contributions of the AWS Heroes community. These exceptional individuals share their expertise through content creation, speaking, and open-source projects. 🤝 The summit provided a platform for networking and collaboration, with discussions on AWS roadmaps and direct feedback opportunities to AWS service teams. 🚀 Notable launches included IPv6 support for AWS App Runner, AWS Client VPN, and RDS Data API, enhancing connectivity…

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Sébastien Stormacq
Category: event

item.title: ICPC World Finals Livestream: ecnerwala and SecondThread Speed-Solving Kotlin Challenge
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🌍 Join us live from the ICPC World Finals in Baku, Azerbaijan, on September 2, 2025, at 9:30 am UTC! Watch top programmers Andrew ‘ecnerwala’ He and David ‘SecondThread’ Harmeyer compete in a real-time Kotlin speed-solving challenge. Hosted by Sebastian Aigner from JetBrains, this event showcases coding mastery under time pressure. Don’t miss the chance to see Kotlin’s strengths and get inspired to join the upcoming Kotlin Heroes contest! #ICPC #KotlinHeroes #CompetitiveProgramming #LiveEvent…

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Ksenia Shneyveys
Category: event

item.title: Hack Week 2025: How these engineers liquid-cooled a GPU server
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🚀 Hack Week 2025 at Dropbox focused on the theme “Keep It Simple,” encouraging innovation and collaboration. One highlight was the “Liquid Cooling CPU/GPU Hardware” project, which won the Learn Fast award. The team developed a custom liquid cooling system for GPU servers to address the thermal demands of AI workloads. This system demonstrated significant benefits, including lower operating temperatures and quieter performance. Future plans include expanding testing across multiple data…

Source: Dropbox Tech Blog
Author: Catie Keck
Category: event

item.title: Ready for the Best School Year Ever? Join Our STEM Clubs, Camps, and Competitions
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🎉 A new school year is here, bringing fresh opportunities in STEM! Join our free online Youth Clubs to enhance your skills in math, coding, and AI. Weekly sessions with expert instructors and a global community await you. 🔍 Explore the Math Club, AI Club, and Coding Club for tailored learning experiences. 🌐 Engage in competitions and prepare for olympiads with peers worldwide! #STEMEducation #YouthClubs #Math #Coding #AI

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Alena Gupaisova
Category: event

item.title: Awe dropping.
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🎉 Mark your calendars! Join us for a special Apple Event on September 9 at 10 a.m. PT. Tune in to watch live on apple.com, Apple TV, or YouTube Live. Don’t miss out on the latest announcements! #AppleEvent #TechNews #LiveStream 📅🍏📺

Source: Apple Developer News
Author: Unknown
Category: event

item.title: Living My Childhood Dream — Thanks to Cisco’s Time2Give Benefit
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
Rana K., a Technical Consulting Engineer at Cisco, shares her inspiring journey of fulfilling a childhood dream through the company’s Time2Give benefit. 🌍✨ This initiative allows employees to dedicate 80 hours annually to volunteer for causes they care about. Rana, originally from Egypt and now living in Poland, has embraced this opportunity to teach and give back globally. She reflects on the connections she’s made, highlighting that cultural differences have not hindered her ability to…

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Rana Khalil
Category: event

item.title: Cloudflare Launching AI Miniseries for Developers (and Everyone Else They Know)
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🚀 Cloudflare has launched “AI Avenue,” a miniseries designed to demystify AI for developers and the general public. Each episode explores AI’s growth, capabilities, and human augmentation stories, making the technology approachable and engaging. Viewers can interact with AI hands-on, breaking down fears and showcasing its potential. Join the journey to learn more at aiavenue.show! #AI #Cloudflare #Innovation #Technology #HumanAugmentation

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Craig Dennis
Category: event

item.title: Watch the premiere of the award-winning animated short NEW IDEA here!
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
🎥 Discover “NEW IDEA,” the award-winning animated short that has captured 26 accolades! This film showcases the inspiring journey of its creator, who faced challenges before finding success. Don’t miss the chance to watch this imaginative piece and appreciate its unique story! #NewIdea #Animation #FilmAwards #ShortFilm #Inspiration ✨

Source: Unreal Engine Blog
Author: Unknown
Category: event

item.title: Kotlin on the Backend – What’s New From KotlinConf 2025
item.dc:creator: Michał Rutkowski
item.description:
KotlinConf 2025 showcased significant advancements in server-side Kotlin. 🌐 Key highlights include a strategic partnership with Spring for enhanced null-safety and Kotlin-centric tutorials. 📚 Developers are increasingly adopting Kotlin for backend, with notable insights shared by leaders from major tech companies. Ktor continues to evolve, offering support for modern scalable applications, including new features for dependency injection and server-driven UI development. For in-depth insights,…

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Alina Dolgikh
Category: event
